User reference for the CyberGIS-Compute Python SDK

cybergis_compute_client.Client module

This module exposes Client class which creates a Client object that serves as a tool to make requests to different servers

Example

client = Client()

class cybergis_compute_client.Client.Client(url='cgjobsup.cigi.illinois.edu', port=443, protocol='HTTPS', suffix='v2')[source]

Client class An inteface that handles requests made to different servers .. attribute:: url

url that needs to be accessed

type

str

port

port of the Jupyter or Python interface

Type

str

suffix

specify version. For e.g v2

Type

str

Initializes instance Client using inputs from the client :param url: url that needs to be accessed :type url: str :param port: port of the Jupyter or Python interface :type port: str :param protocol: Typically HTTP or HTTPS :type protocol: str :param suffix: specify version. For e.g v2 :type suffix: str

Returns

this Client

Return type

(obj)

download(uri, body, localDir)[source]

Downloads data from a request made to the specified uri onto the specifed path :param uri: uri of the server :type uri: str :param body: data that needs to be dowloaded :type body: str :param localDir: path where the data needs to be downloaded :type localDir: str

Returns

path where the data is stored

Return type

str

request(method, uri, body={})[source]

Returns data from a request made to the specified uri :param methods: type of request that needs to be made. For e.g “POST” :type methods: str :param uri: uri of the server :type uri: str :param body: data that needs to be sent :type body: str

Returns

output thats returned by the server

Return type

JSON

upload(uri, body, file)[source]

Uploads data using a request made to the specified uri :param uri: uri of the server :type uri: str :param body: data that needs to be uploaded :type body: str :param file: file that needs to be uploaded :type file: str

Returns

output from the upload request to the server

Return type

JSON

cybergis_compute_client.CyberGISCompute module

This module exposes CyberGISCompute class which creates a CyberGISCompute object that serves as an entry point to the CyberGISX environment from a Python/Jupyter notebook. All interactions with the High Performance Computing (HPC) backend are performed using this object.

Example

cybergis = CyberGISCompute(url=’localhost’, port=’3030’, protocol=’HTTP’, isJupyter=False)

class cybergis_compute_client.CyberGISCompute.CyberGISCompute(url='cgjobsup.cigi.illinois.edu', port=443, protocol='HTTPS', suffix='', isJupyter=True)[source]

CyberGISCompute class An inteface that handles all interactions with the HPC backend .. attribute:: client

Initialized using url(str), protocol(str), port(str) and suffix(str)

type

Client object

jupyterhubApiToken

jupyterhub’s REST API token that can be used to authenticate the user

Type

string

(https

//jhubdocs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/jupyterhub/docs/source/rest.html)

username

username

Type

string

isJupyter

set to True if you are working in a jupyter environment.

Type

boolean

If you are working in a simple Python environment then set to False
ui

Serves as entry point to UI functionality

Type

UI

job

Serves as entry point to access job interactions

Type

Job

recentDownloadPath

Gets the most recent download path from globus

Type

str

jupyterhubHost

static variable that stores the path to jupyterhubHost

Type

str

Initializes instance CyberGISCompute using inputs from the client :param url: url that needs to be accessed :type url: str :param port: port of the Jupyter or Python interface :type port: str :param protocol: Typically HTTP or HTTPS :type protocol: str :param suffix: specify version. For e.g v2 :type suffix: str :param isJupyter: set to True if you are using Jupyter environment :type isJupyter: booleans

Returns

this CyberGISCompute

Return type

(obj)

Creates a job object Initializes instance CyberGISCompute using inputs from the client :param maintainer: Pre-packaged programs which can be configured and controlled remotely :type maintainer: str :param and behave as a bridge between user and HPC backends: :param hpc: HPC backend that is being accessed. For e.g ‘keeling_community’ :type hpc: str :param hpcUsername: username for HPC backend :type hpcUsername: str :param hpcPassword: password for HPC backend :type hpcPassword: str :param printJob: prints the Job infortmation if set to True :type printJob: str

Returns

The new job instance that was initialized

Return type

(Job)

cybergis_compute_client.GlobusUtil module

This module exposes GlobusUtil class which creates a GlobusUtil object that serves as an entry point to the Globus Data Transfer Tool

Example

cybergis = GlobusUtil(compute)

class cybergis_compute_client.GlobusUtil.GlobusUtil(compute)[source]

GlobusUtil class An inteface that handles all interactions with Globus Data Transfer Tool .. attribute:: compute

instance of CyberGISCompute that was initialized earlier

type

CyberGISCompute

Initializes instance GlobusUtil using inputs from the client :param compute: compute instance that was initialized by the user :type compute: CyberGISCompute

Returns

this GlobusUtils

Return type

(obj)

download(endpoint, path, hpc)[source]

Sends a download request to Globus API

Parameters

  • endpoint (str) – endpoint that needs to be accessed

  • path (str) – path to endpoint

  • hpc (str) – hpc resource where the endpoint is located. For e.g “keeling-community”

Returns

None

upload(endpoint, path, hpc)[source]

Sends an upload request to Globus API :param endpoint: endpoint that needs to be accessed :type endpoint: str :param path: path to endpoint :type path: str :param hpc: hpc resource where the endpoint is located. For e.g “keeling-community” :type hpc: str

Returns

None

cybergis_compute_client.JAT module

class cybergis_compute_client.JAT.JAT[source]

Job Access Token (JAT) class .. attribute:: accessTokenCache

All cached access tokens with the date submitted as keys

type

dict

id

Unique identifier for the job assigned by the client

Type

str

secretToken

Token to generate JAT signature provided by the client

Type

str

algorithm

Algorithm used to hash the signature

Type

str

getAccessToken()[source]

Returns the access token signaure of this job, and adds it to the cache if it is not already there

Returns

Access token signature, in the form of 4 Base64-URL strings separated by dots

Return type

(str)

getDate()[source]

Returns the current date (year, month, day, hour) :param none:

Returns

The current date

Return type

(str)

hash(payload)[source]

Constructs a compact access token with the given payload :param payload: payload to be hashed :type payload: str

Returns

(str) hashed payload

init(algorithm, id, secretToken)[source]

Initializes instance data with data from the client :param accessTokenCache: All cached access tokens with the dates submitted as keys :type accessTokenCache: dict :param id: Unique identifier for the job (assigned by the client) :type id: str :param secretToken: Token to generate JAT signature (provided by the client) :type secretToken: str :param algorithm: Algorithm used to hash the signature :type algorithm: str

Returns

this JAT

Return type

(obj)

parseAccessToken(accessToken)[source]

Returns decoded information from the access token in the form of a dictionary :param accessToken: The job’s access token, in the form of 4 Base64-URL strings separated by dots :type accessToken: str

Returns

Algorithm, payload (both encoded and decoded), id, and the hash associated with a job’s secret token, id, and payload.

Return type

(dict)

basicEventTypes = ['JOB_QUEUED', 'JOB_REGISTERED', 'JOB_INIT', 'GLOBUS_TRANSFER_INIT_SUCCESS', 'JOB_ENDED', 'JOB_FAILED']
downloadResultFolder(dir=None)[source]

Downloads the result folder and returns information about it :param (dir): Location to download the files to

Returns

Output from the client when downloading the results using globus.

Return type

(dict)

download_result_folder(localPath=None, remotePath=None, raw=False)[source]

Downloads the folder with results from the job using Globus :param localPath: Path to the local result folder :type localPath: string :param remotePath: Path to the remote result folder :type remotePath: string :param raw: If the function should return the output from the client :type raw: bool

Returns

Output from the client when downloading the results using globus. Only returned when raw is true.

Return type

(dict)

Raises

  • Exception – If the job ID is None

  • Exception – If the key ‘resultFolder’ is not returned with status

  • Exception – If the result folder is formatted improperly

events(raw=False, liveOutput=True, basic=True, refreshRateInSeconds=10)[source]

While the job is running, display the events generated by the client :param raw: If true, return a list of the events generated by status :type raw: bool :param liveOutput: :type liveOutput: bool :param basic: If true, exclude non-basicEventType events :type basic: bool :param RefreshRateInSeconds: Number of seconds to wait before refreshing status :type RefreshRateInSeconds: int

logs(raw=False, liveOutput=True, refreshRateInSeconds=15)[source]

While the job is running, display the logs generated by the client. :param raw: If true, return a list of the events generated by status :type raw: bool :param liveOutput: :type liveOutput: bool :param RefreshRateInSeconds: Number of seconds to wait before refreshing status :type RefreshRateInSeconds: int

Returns

List of logs generated by the client. Only returned if raw is true.

Return type

(list)

set(executableFolder=None, dataFolder=None, resultFolder=None, param=None, env=None, slurm=None, printJob=True)[source]

PUT requests information about this job to the client so it can be submitted to the hpc. Displays information about this job unless specified otherwise. :param executableFolder: Path of the executable folder :type executableFolder: str :param dataFolder: Path of the data folder :type dataFolder: str :param resultFolder: Path of the result folder :type resultFolder: str :param param: Rules for input data :type param: dict :param env: Enviorment variables required by the appliation :type env: dict :param slurm: Slurm input rules :type slurm: dict :param printJob: If the status of the job should be printed

status(raw=False)[source]

Displays the status of this job, and returns it if specified. :param raw: If information about this job should be returned :type raw: bool

Returns

Infomation about this job returned by the client. This includes the job’s ‘id’, ‘hpc’, ‘executableFolder’, ‘dataFolder’, ‘resultFolder’, ‘param’, ‘slurm’, ‘userId’, ‘maintainer’, ‘createdAt’, and ‘events’

Return type

(dict)

Raises

Exception – If the ‘id’ attribute is None

submit()[source]

Submits this job to the client, and prints the output :returns: This job :rtype: (obj)

cybergis_compute_client.Zip module

This module exposes Zip class which creates an in-memory zip object to avoid disk access

Example

zip = Zip()

class cybergis_compute_client.Zip.Zip[source]

Zip class An interface that creates an in-memory zip object to avoid disk access

in_memory_zip

A BytesIO in-memory file

Inits Zip with in_memory_zip

append(filename_in_zip, file_contents)[source]

Appends a file with name filename_in_zip and contents of file_contents to the in-memory zip. :param filename_in_zip: Name of the zip_file :type filename_in_zip: str :param file_contents: Contents that need to be written to the zip_file :type file_contents: str

Returns

this Zip

Return type

(obj)
